bestBHT.bht: Nicodemus, a member of the Sanhedrin, boldly defended Jesus, highlighting the injustice of condemning someone without hearing them. Despite initially coming to Jesus by night, Nicodemus now fearlessly spoke out and put the proud and domineering to shame. Through his consistent character and his clandestine discipleship with Joseph of Arimathea, Nicodemus exemplified a hidden spark of godliness. He played a crucial role in the gradual growth of Jesus' teachings and the vindication of God's law.

Henry Alford: The Jews had, since the sabbath-healing, condemned Jesus, and were seeking to kill him."
But in Exod. xxiii. 1, 2; Deut. 1. 16, 17, justice is commanded to be done in the way here insisted on by Nicodemus."
Observe the consistency, and development, of the character of Nicodemus; and see more on ch. xix. 39.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: to us after nearly three years' absence from the history, as a member
of the council, probably then sitting.
Albert Barnes: God often places one or more pious men in legislative assemblies to vindicate his honor and his law.
He often gives a man grace on such occasions boldly to defend his cause; to put men upon their proof, and to confound the proud and the domineering.

This example should lead every man entrusted with authority or office fearlessly to defend the truth of God, and, when the rich and the mighty are pouring contempt on Jesus and his cause, to stand forth as its fearless defender.
Marvin Vincent: He that came to Him by night."
The texts vary, either substituting proteron, before, for nuktov, by night, or omitting the whole clause.
Nicodemus saith unto them, being one of them.
John Calvin: He who came to Jesus by night...some small spark of godliness shines from his heart."
He says that he once came to Jesus by night, but remained openly among his enemies, and kept his place in their camp.
The Lord frequently causes the doctrine, which seemed to have perished, gradually to take a concealed root, and, after a long period, to put forth some bud.
Archibald T. Robertson: Nicodemus boldly protests against the injustice of condemning Jesus unheard."
He appears once more in John 19:39 with Joseph of Arimathea as a secret disciple of Jesus.
Being one of them, as a member of the Sanhedrin, he takes up the challenge.
John Gill: He that came to Jesus by night."
John Wesley: Do not we ourselves act as if we knew not the law, if we pass sentence on a man before we hear him?
Having now a little more courage, being one of them.
Being present as a member of the great council.

bhtAttempts.bht: Nicodemus, a member of the Sanhedrin, boldly spoke out against the Jews who had condemned Jesus, pointing out the injustice of condemning someone unheard. Though he had once come to Jesus by night, he now fearlessly defended the truth and put the proud and domineering to shame. Nicodemus's consistent character and his appearance alongside Joseph of Arimathea as a secret disciple of Jesus show his small spark of godliness. Even though he remained openly among his enemies and kept his place in their camp, Nicodemus played an important role in the gradual growth of the doctrine and the vindication of God's law.

Nicodemus, a member of the Sanhedrin, boldly spoke out against the Jews who had condemned Jesus, pointing out the injustice of condemning someone unheard. Though he had once come to Jesus by night, he now fearlessly defended the truth and put the proud and domineering to shame. Nicodemus's consistent character and his appearance alongside Joseph of Arimathea as a secret disciple of Jesus show his small spark of godliness. He played an important role in the gradual growth of the doctrine and the vindication of God's law.

Nicodemus, a member of the Sanhedrin, boldly defended Jesus, highlighting the injustice of condemning someone without hearing them. Despite initially coming to Jesus by night, Nicodemus now fearlessly spoke out and put the proud and domineering to shame. Through his consistent character and his clandestine discipleship with Joseph of Arimathea, Nicodemus exemplified a hidden spark of godliness. He played a crucial role in the gradual growth of Jesus' teachings and the vindication of God's law.

Nicodemus, a member of the Sanhedrin, fearlessly defended Jesus, pointing out the injustice of condemning Him unheard. Although he came to Jesus by night initially, Nicodemus boldly protested against the Jews' condemnation. His consistent character and his secret discipleship with Joseph of Arimathea revealed a hidden spark of godliness. Nicodemus played a significant role in the development of Jesus' teachings, as depicted in his reemergence in John 19:39. His presence in the council demonstrated his willingness to stand up for the truth and uphold God's law in the face of opposition.

Nicodemus, a member of the Sanhedrin, fearlessly defended Jesus, pointing out the injustice of condemning Him unheard. His consistent character and secret discipleship revealed a hidden spark of godliness. Nicodemus played a significant role in the development of Jesus' teachings. His presence in the council demonstrated his willingness to stand up for the truth and uphold God's law in the face of opposition. His boldness and defense of Jesus serves as an example for all entrusted with authority to fearlessly defend the cause of Christ.
